PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE

 

 

     

 

Lecturer in Biochemistry, 1979, Faculty of Agronomy, Central University of Venezuela, Maracay,
Venezuela. Lecturer in General Chemistry, 1979-1981, School of Chemistry, Faculty of Science,
Central University of Venezuela, Caracas, Venezuela.

PRESENT POSITION

Instructor, 1992, Div of Ped Surg, Johns Hopkins University Sch of Med, Baltimore, MD
PUBLICATIONS

1. A. De Maio and J.A. Urbina. *7rypanosoma (Schizotrypanum) cruzi: Terminal oxidases in

exponential and stationary growth phase epimastigotes cultured in vitro.” Acta Cient. Venz
35:136, 1986.

 

2. A. De Malo, H. Lis, J.M. Gerhoni, and N. Sharon. “Identification of glycoproteins that are
receptors for peanut agglutinin on immature (cortical) mouse thymocytes.” FEBS Lett. 194:28.
1986.

 

3. A. De Malo, H. Lis, J.M. Gerhoni, and N. Sharon. "Identification of peanut agglutinin-binding
‘glycoproteins on immature human thymocytes." Cell. Immunol. 99:345, 1986.

4. S. Ehilich-Rogozinski, A. De Maio, H. Lis, and N. Sharon. “The glycolipid specificity of Erythrina
cristagalli agglutinin.” Glycoconjugate J. 4:379, 1987

5. A. De Maio, and 7.G. Buchman. "Mammalian liver contains an activity which mimics bacterial
chloramphenicol acetyl transferase." Biochim. et Biophys. Acta. 1087:303, 1990.

6. A. De Maio, and 7.6. Buchman. "Molecular biology of circulatory shock. 1V. Transtation and
secretion of Hep G2 cell proteins are independently attenuated during heat shock.” Cire. Shock
34:24, 1991.

7. C.A. Clairmont, A. De Maio, and C.8. Hirschberg. “Translocation of ATP into the lumen of rough.

endoplasmic reticulum-derived vesicles and its binding to lumenal proteins including BIP (GRP78)
and GAP94", J. Biol. Chem., 267:3983-3890, 1992.

summary: Antonio De Maio, Ph.D. Instructor, Pediatric Surgery. Professor of Biochemistry, Central University of Venezuela, Maracay, Venezuela. Lecturer in General Chemistry, 1979-1981, School of chemistry, Faculty of Science, Caracas. Assistant professor of Pediatrics, Johns Hopkins University Sch of Med, Baltimore, MD.
